definition: to walk on tiptoe/to walk quietly/to tread (on)/to follow
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to walk on tiptoe/to walk quietly/to tread (on)/to follow
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: Not wishing to disturb his baby sister, he tiptoed into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他不想打扰他的小妹妹，蹑手蹑脚地走进了屋里。

sentences.english: I inched my way toward the door and heard it again.
sentences.chinese: 我蹑手蹑脚的朝屋门走过去，这个声音又发出了一次。
她蹑手蹑脚地走到窗前。

sentences.english: Creep up to a sleeping mamba , tweak it by the tail. Crikey!
sentences.chinese: 他会蹑手蹑脚的走向一条熟睡的大王蛇，扭它的尾巴。

sentences.english: She tiptoed out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 她蹑手蹑脚地走出了房间。

sentences.english: I couldn't help walking into the room again on tiptoe.
sentences.chinese: 我忍不住又蹑手蹑脚溜回爷爷的屋子。

sentences.english: "Not a word, " said Quilp, making towards the door on tiptoe .
sentences.chinese: “不要说话，”奎尔普说着，蹑手蹑脚地向门口走去。

sentences.english: Raine had to duck down as he slipped into the Ark.
sentences.chinese: 雷恩弯下身子蹑手蹑脚走进方舟。

sentences.english: I walked slowly into my bedroom with a devious smile, thinking, that will teach her.
sentences.chinese: 我偷笑着蹑手蹑脚走回我的房间，我想这下教训了她。

sentences.english: She padded up in her barefeet to the next room.
sentences.chinese: 她赤着脚，蹑手蹑脚地走到隔壁房间里去。

sentences.english: I walked on tiptoe to the door.
sentences.chinese: 我蹑手蹑脚地走到门旁。

sentences.english: When the sicken child feel into asleep, the mother slipped in.
sentences.chinese: 生病的孩子睡着后，他妈妈蹑手蹑脚进来了。

sentences.english: She ogles at him and they tiptoe to her bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 她妩媚地瞅瞅他，两个人蹑手蹑脚进了她的卧房。

sentences.english: We crept around on (our) tiptoes so as not to disturb him.
sentences.chinese: 为了不打扰他，我们蹑手蹑脚地走过去。

sentences.english: They crept toward the house, toward the door.
sentences.chinese: 他们蹑手蹑脚，向房子和大门走去，手中握着长刀。

sentences.english: I crept upstairs and tried to open the door soundlessly.
sentences.chinese: 我蹑手蹑脚地上楼，悄无声息地打开门。

definition: (to move or do sth) softly and quietly (idiom)
to walk cautiously in order not to make noise
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
lit. to behave like a thief/furtive/underhand
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
with a rolling or twisting movement/in a single movement/in one breath
